contextId.information: The abstract noun "complaint" can be translated as the verb "complain." AT: "I would stop complaining" or "I would stop complaining against God" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_abstractnouns]])
contextId.quote: I would forget about my complaints

contextId.information: The abstract noun "sorrows" can be expressed as a verb. AT: "what will hurt me" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_abstractnouns]])
contextId.quote: all my sorrows

contextId.information: How Job feels is compared to a bitter taste. The abstract noun "bitterness" can be translated as the adverb "bitterly." AT: "My inner being will speak bitterly" or "I will bitterly speak out" (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_metaphor]] and [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_abstractnouns]])
contextId.quote: I will speak in the bitterness of my soul

contextId.information: Here the abstract noun "life" means physical life and "covenant faithfulness" refers to God being faithful to his promises. They can be translated as verbs. AT: "You have allowed me to live and have faithfully protected me" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_abstractnouns]])
contextId.quote: You have granted me life and covenant faithfulness

contextId.information: The abstract noun "suffering" can be translated using the verb "suffer." AT: "and am looking at how I suffer" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_abstractnouns]])
contextId.quote: and am looking at my own suffering

contextId.information: The abstract noun "rest" can be expressed with the verb "rest." AT: "you would lie down and rest" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_abstractnouns]])
contextId.quote: you would lie down in rest

contextId.information: The abstract nouns "wisdom" and "might" can be expressed with the adjectives "wise" and "mighty." AT: "God is wise and mighty" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_abstractnouns]])
contextId.quote: With God are wisdom and might

contextId.information: The abstract nouns "strength" and "wisdom" can be expressed with the words "strong" and wise. AT "God is strong and wise" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_abstractnouns]])
contextId.quote: With him are strength and wisdom

contextId.information: The abstract noun "sorrow" can be expressed with the words "sad" or "grieve" AT: "and they feel very sad" or "and they grieve" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_abstractnouns]])
contextId.quote: in sorrow

contextId.information: The abstract noun "sorrow" can be expressed with the words "sad" or "grieve" AT: "and they feel very sad" or "and they grieve" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_abstractnouns]])
contextId.quote: in sorrow

contextId.information: The abstract noun "acquittal" can be expressed with the verb "acquit." AT: "This is the reason that God will acquit me" or "This is the reason that God will say that I am not guilty" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_abstractnouns]])
contextId.quote: This will be the reason for my acquittal

contextId.information: The abstract noun "hope" can be expressed with the verb "hope." The hope is explained in verses 7-9. AT: "We can hope that a tree will live again" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_abstractnouns]] and  [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_explicit]])
contextId.quote: There can be hope for a tree

contextId.information: The abstract noun "hopes" can be expressed with the verb "hope" AT: "the things that man hopes for" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_abstractnouns]])
contextId.quote: the hopes of man

contextId.information: The word "mockery" can be expressed as a verb. AT: "to mock you" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_abstractnouns]])
contextId.quote: in mockery

contextId.information: The abstract noun "height" can be expressed with the adjective "tall." AT: "Though he is as tall as the heavens" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_abstractnouns]])
contextId.quote: Though his height reaches up to the heavens

contextId.information: The abstract noun "height" represents his reputation or pride. Both of these ideas can be expressed with other types of phrases. AT: "Though people think that he is a very great man" or "Though he is very proud" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_abstractnouns]] and [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_metaphor]])
contextId.quote: Though his height reaches up to the heavens

contextId.information: Here "him" refers to God. The abstract nouns "dominion" and "fear" can be stated as verbs. AT: "Dominion and fear are with God" or "God rules over all, and people should fear only him" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_abstractnouns]])
contextId.quote: Dominion and fear are with him

contextId.information: The abstract noun "brightness" can be stated as an adjective. AT: "the moon is not bright enough for God" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_abstractnouns]])
contextId.quote: the moon has no brightness to him

contextId.information: The abstract noun "breath" can be translated with the verb "breathe" or "blow." This image represents God causing the wind to blow away the clouds. AT: "By breathing, God made the skies clear" or "God blew away the clouds so that the skies were clear" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_abstractnouns]] and [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_metaphor]])
contextId.quote: By his breath he made the skies clear

contextId.information: The abstract noun "life" can be expressed with the adjective "alive" or the verb "live." AT: "as long as I am still alive"  or "while I still live" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_abstractnouns]])
contextId.quote: while my life is yet in me

contextId.information: "I will never agree with you and say that you three are right" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_abstractnouns]])
contextId.quote: I will never admit that you three are right

contextId.information: The abstract noun "mockery" can be expressed with the verb "mock."  AT: "only mock me" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_abstractnouns]])
contextId.quote: have nothing but mockery for me

contextId.information: The abstract noun "poverty" can be expressed with the word "poor." The abstract noun "hunger" can be expressed with the words "hungry" or "starving." AT: "They were very thin because they were poor and starving" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_abstractnouns]])
contextId.quote: They were thin from poverty and hunger

contextId.information: The abstract nouns "song" and "mockery" can be expressed with the verbs "sing" and "mock. AT: "But now their sons sing songs about me to mock me" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_abstractnouns]])
contextId.quote: But now, for their sons I have become their subject for a song of mockery

contextId.information: The abstract noun "hope" can be translated with the verbs "trust" or "hope." AT: "If I trusted in gold" or "If I hoped that having a lot of gold would make me secure" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_abstractnouns]])
contextId.quote: If I have made gold my hope

contextId.information: The abstract noun "destruction" can be translated with the verb "destroy." AT: "when anyone who hated me was destroyed" or "when bad things happened to anyone who hated me" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_abstractnouns]])
contextId.quote: at the destruction of anyone who hated me

contextId.information: The word "cry" can be expressed as a verb. This speaks of God hearing their cry as if they cry were a person that came to him. AT: "they made the poor people cry, and God heard them" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_abstractnouns]] and [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_personification]])
contextId.quote: they made the cry of poor people come to him

contextId.information: The word "oppression" can be translated with a verbal phrase. AT: "Because of the many things that people do to oppress others" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_abstractnouns]])
contextId.quote: Because of many acts of oppression

contextId.information: The phrase "the extensive spread" can be translated with a verbal phrase. AT: "how the clouds spread across the sky" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_abstractnouns]])
contextId.quote: the extensive spread of the clouds

contextId.information: The word "correction" can be translated with a verbal phrase. The object of his "correction" is people. AT: "sometimes it happens to correct his people" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_abstractnouns]] and [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_explicit]])
contextId.quote: sometimes it happens for correction

contextId.information: The abstract noun "folly" can be translated as an adjective. AT: "even though you have been very foolish, and deserve to have me punish you severely, I will not do that" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_abstractnouns]])
contextId.quote: I may not deal with you after your folly
